body:
Comment 4: 
I am not following your disagreement with tail calls.  The embedded trampoline is making
a tail call.  Tail calls are an easy and high-level optimization to implement in a
compiler.  If you do not want this optimization to trigger in ordinary code for whatever
reason, that is fine.  It is still relevant in the trampoline case.

Today, the embedded trampolines are a source of fragility.  They are not generated by
the same means as other functions and because of that they not subject to analysis and
annotations as other functions are.  If genwrapper can do the same work and generate as
good code, it will remove a big special case in the three backends. Our compiler will be
simpler and have fewer source lines of code to maintain.
